“That's fine with me.” You respond, checking your inventory. “Oh, hell, this is going to cost money, right?”

“Mmm...” She shakes her head, thinking briefly before extending her hands to accept your blade. “No, first one is free.”

You watch; the witch runs her hand from the steel blade's base to the point, the still-beating heart in her hand dissolving into red dust that flows into the metal, heating it white-hot, giggling dementedly from deep in her throat for the duration of the entire process. A few heads turn in the market square as red light creeps across the ground between the stands, then stops at once as she brandishes the weapon and hands it to you, hilt-first.

“I hope this is satisfactory.” She responds.
